<a id="BaseButton"></a>

# BaseButton

**Inherits:** [Control](Control.md) **\<** [CanvasItem](CanvasItem.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [Button](Button.md), [LinkButton](LinkButton.md), [TextureButton](TextureButton.md)

Abstract base class for GUI buttons.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**BaseButton** is an abstract base class for GUI buttons. It doesn't display anything by itself.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Signals

<a id="BaseButton_signal_button_down"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**button_down**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_signal_button_down)

Emitted when the button starts being held down.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_signal_button_up"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**button_up**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_signal_button_up)

Emitted when the button stops being held down.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_signal_pressed"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**pressed**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_signal_pressed)

Emitted when the button is toggled or pressed. This is on [button_down](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_signal_button_down) if [action_mode](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_property_action_mode) is [ACTION_MODE_BUTTON_PRESS](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_constant_ACTION_MODE_BUTTON_PRESS) and on [button_up](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_signal_button_up) otherwise.

If you need to know the button's pressed state (and [toggle_mode](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_property_toggle_mode) is active), use [toggled](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_signal_toggled) instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_signal_toggled"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**toggled**\ (\ toggled_on\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_signal_toggled)

Emitted when the button was just toggled between pressed and normal states (only if [toggle_mode](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_property_toggle_mode) is active). The new state is contained in the `toggled_on` argument.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_BaseButton_DrawMode"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **DrawMode**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_BaseButton_DrawMode)

<a id="BaseButton_constant_DRAW_NORMAL"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[DrawMode](BaseButton.md#enum_BaseButton_DrawMode) **DRAW_NORMAL** = `0`

The normal state (i.e. not pressed, not hovered, not toggled and enabled) of buttons.<a id="BaseButton_constant_DRAW_PRESSED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[DrawMode](BaseButton.md#enum_BaseButton_DrawMode) **DRAW_PRESSED** = `1`

The state of buttons are pressed.<a id="BaseButton_constant_DRAW_HOVER"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[DrawMode](BaseButton.md#enum_BaseButton_DrawMode) **DRAW_HOVER** = `2`

The state of buttons are hovered.<a id="BaseButton_constant_DRAW_DISABLED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[DrawMode](BaseButton.md#enum_BaseButton_DrawMode) **DRAW_DISABLED** = `3`

The state of buttons are disabled.<a id="BaseButton_constant_DRAW_HOVER_PRESSED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[DrawMode](BaseButton.md#enum_BaseButton_DrawMode) **DRAW_HOVER_PRESSED** = `4`

The state of buttons are both hovered and pressed.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_BaseButton_ActionMode"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **ActionMode**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_BaseButton_ActionMode)

<a id="BaseButton_constant_ACTION_MODE_BUTTON_PRESS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ActionMode](BaseButton.md#enum_BaseButton_ActionMode) **ACTION_MODE_BUTTON_PRESS** = `0`

Require just a press to consider the button clicked.<a id="BaseButton_constant_ACTION_MODE_BUTTON_RELEASE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ActionMode](BaseButton.md#enum_BaseButton_ActionMode) **ACTION_MODE_BUTTON_RELEASE** = `1`

Require a press and a subsequent release before considering the button clicked.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="BaseButton_property_action_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[ActionMode](BaseButton.md#enum_BaseButton_ActionMode) **action_mode** = `1` [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_property_action_mode)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_action_mode**\ (\ value\: [ActionMode](BaseButton.md#enum_BaseButton_ActionMode)\ )
- [ActionMode](BaseButton.md#enum_BaseButton_ActionMode) **get_action_mode**\ (\ )

Determines when the button is considered clicked.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_property_button_group"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[ButtonGroup](ButtonGroup.md) **button_group** [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_property_button_group)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_button_group**\ (\ value\: [ButtonGroup](ButtonGroup.md)\ )
- [ButtonGroup](ButtonGroup.md) **get_button_group**\ (\ )

The [ButtonGroup](ButtonGroup.md) associated with the button. Not to be confused with node groups.

\ **Note:** The button will be configured as a radio button if a [ButtonGroup](ButtonGroup.md) is assigned to it.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_property_button_mask"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

**BitField**\[[MouseButtonMask](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_MouseButtonMask)\] **button_mask** = `1` [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_property_button_mask)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_button_mask**\ (\ value\: **BitField**\[[MouseButtonMask](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_MouseButtonMask)\]\ )
- **BitField**\[[MouseButtonMask](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_MouseButtonMask)\] **get_button_mask**\ (\ )

Binary mask to choose which mouse buttons this button will respond to.

To allow both left-click and right-click, use ``MOUSE_BUTTON_MASK_LEFT | MOUSE_BUTTON_MASK_RIGHT``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_property_button_pressed"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **button_pressed** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_property_button_pressed)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_pressed**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_pressed**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the button's state is pressed. Means the button is pressed down or toggled (if [toggle_mode](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_property_toggle_mode) is active). Only works if [toggle_mode](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_property_toggle_mode) is ``true``.

\ **Note:** Changing the value of [button_pressed](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_property_button_pressed) will result in [toggled](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_signal_toggled) to be emitted. If you want to change the pressed state without emitting that signal, use [set_pressed_no_signal()](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_method_set_pressed_no_signal).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_property_disabled"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **disabled** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_property_disabled)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_disabled**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_disabled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the button is in disabled state and can't be clicked or toggled.

\ **Note:** If the button is disabled while held down, [button_up](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_signal_button_up) will be emitted.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_property_keep_pressed_outside"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **keep_pressed_outside** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_property_keep_pressed_outside)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_keep_pressed_outside**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_keep_pressed_outside**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the button stays pressed when moving the cursor outside the button while pressing it.

\ **Note:** This property only affects the button's visual appearance. Signals will be emitted at the same moment regardless of this property's value.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_property_shortcut"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Shortcut](Shortcut.md) **shortcut** [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_property_shortcut)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_shortcut**\ (\ value\: [Shortcut](Shortcut.md)\ )
- [Shortcut](Shortcut.md) **get_shortcut**\ (\ )

[Shortcut](Shortcut.md) associated to the button.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_property_shortcut_feedback"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **shortcut_feedback** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_property_shortcut_feedback)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_shortcut_feedback**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_shortcut_feedback**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the button will highlight for a short amount of time when its shortcut is activated. If ``false`` and [toggle_mode](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_property_toggle_mode) is ``false``, the shortcut will activate without any visual feedback.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_property_shortcut_in_tooltip"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **shortcut_in_tooltip** = `true` [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_property_shortcut_in_tooltip)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_shortcut_in_tooltip**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_shortcut_in_tooltip_enabled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the button will add information about its shortcut in the tooltip.

\ **Note:** This property does nothing when the tooltip control is customized using [Control._make_custom_tooltip()](Control.md#Control_private_method__make_custom_tooltip).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_property_toggle_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **toggle_mode** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_property_toggle_mode)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_toggle_mode**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_toggle_mode**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the button is in toggle mode. Makes the button flip state between pressed and unpressed each time its area is clicked.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="BaseButton_private_method__pressed"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_pressed**\ (\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_private_method__pressed)

Called when the button is pressed. If you need to know the button's pressed state (and [toggle_mode](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_property_toggle_mode) is active), use [_toggled()](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_private_method__toggled) instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_private_method__toggled"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_toggled**\ (\ toggled_on\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_private_method__toggled)

Called when the button is toggled (only if [toggle_mode](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_property_toggle_mode) is active).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_method_get_draw_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[DrawMode](BaseButton.md#enum_BaseButton_DrawMode) **get_draw_mode**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_method_get_draw_mode)

Returns the visual state used to draw the button. This is useful mainly when implementing your own draw code by either overriding _draw() or connecting to "draw" signal. The visual state of the button is defined by the [DrawMode](BaseButton.md#enum_BaseButton_DrawMode) enum.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_method_is_hovered"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_hovered**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_method_is_hovered)

Returns ``true`` if the mouse has entered the button and has not left it yet.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="BaseButton_method_set_pressed_no_signal"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_pressed_no_signal**\ (\ pressed\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#BaseButton_method_set_pressed_no_signal)

Changes the [button_pressed](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_property_button_pressed) state of the button, without emitting [toggled](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_signal_toggled). Use when you just want to change the state of the button without sending the pressed event (e.g. when initializing scene). Only works if [toggle_mode](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_property_toggle_mode) is ``true``.

\ **Note:** This method doesn't unpress other buttons in [button_group](BaseButton.md#BaseButton_property_button_group).
